page.title: 16NORWICH CITY F.C. & DRAYTON
page.content: The chairman of Norwich City football club,{Sir Arthur South,}lives in Drayton.Sir Arthur has recently been in the news, speaking about the ban imposed on English clubs after the tragic{riot in Brussels. {John Deehan,}Norwich's striker is also involved with the area as his daughter attends the local 1st school. John puts in a lot of time helping with fund-raising activities. The climax to the season came with {Norwich}defeating{Sunderland}1 - 0 in the{Milk Cup Final.}Many Drayton families travelled to{Wembley}to watch the match,and the pupils at the school were delighted when John Deehan brought in the famous Cup for them to see and hold.Despite cup success, the club had a run of losses and were {relegated}to the 2nd Division of the Canon League at the end of the season.
